dt: {bc}something resembling a boiling cauldron in intensity or degree of agitation

et: Middle English {it}caudron, caldron{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}cauderon{/it}, diminutive of {it}caldere{/it} basin, from Late Latin {it}caldaria{/it}, from feminine of Latin {it}caldarius{/it} used for hot water, from {it}calidus{/it} warm, from {it}calēre{/it} to be warm {ma}{mat|lee|}{/ma}
